thread.title: Louisiana woman rescues officer being beaten with his own baton
thread.title_full: Louisiana woman rescues officer being beaten with his own baton

author: Jessa Schroeder
title: Louisiana woman rescues officer being beaten with his own baton
text:
Louisiana woman rescues police officer as he's beaten with his own baton: ‘I could see in his eyes he needed help’ Louisiana woman rescues officer as he's beaten with his own baton NEW YORK DAILY NEWS  44 PM 
Roles reversed for a Louisiana woman and a local police officer when she spotted him being beaten during a car search and decided to intervene. 
The unidentified officer reportedly pulled Thomas Bennett, 28, over after he saw him sleeping inside his vehicle and suspected drug use. 
Vickie Williams-Tillman, 56, saw the suspect grab a “baton and use it to hit the officer in the head” during the roadside inspection when she decided to take matters into her own hands, WBRZ reports . 
"I could see in his eyes he needed help. You don't have time to think about it... I did what God needed me to do,” Williams-Tillman told The Advocate. 
SEE IT: Georgia police officer’s heroic rescue 
The Baton Rouge Police Department said not only did the brave woman call for more police, she also took her services much further. Vickie Williams-Tillman, a 56-year-old good Samaritan who jumped on a man's back while he was attacking a Baton Rouge police officer, is being called a hero for her actions. (Baton Rouge Police Department/Facebook) 
"Risking her own safety, she jumped out of her vehicle and onto the back of the 28-year-old assailant. Ms. Williams-Tillman was able to help hold off the assailant until other officers arrived,” the department wrote in a Facebook post. 
"For going above and beyond in that moment to help our officer and possibly save his life, we are forever grateful to you Ms. Vickie! For showing so much love and concern for one of our officers BRPD Salutes you.” 
Bennett was cited for possession of cocaine and drug paraphernalia. 
He was booked on several other charges, including aggravated battery, disarming a police officer and resisting an officer with violence. 
His bond has been set at $167,500. Tags:
